pull.title: ci: Move wine prefix to /tmp to avoid error D8037 in cl.exe
pull.body:
Don't ask me why this makes a difference. It may be some permission problem even though everything in Cirrus CI runs as root anyway. In any case, I'll probably get mad if I investigate this further.

Fixes #1326.

issue.title: ci: Fix error D8037 in `cl.exe` (attempt 2)
issue.body:
Since the https://github.com/mstorsjo/msvc-wine/commit/2146cbfaf037e21de56c7157ec40bb6372860f51, the `msvc-wine` effectively initializes the WINE prefix when running the `install.sh` script. See [`install.sh`#L143](https://github.com/mstorsjo/msvc-wine/blob/2146cbfaf037e21de56c7157ec40bb6372860f51/install.sh#L143): 
```sh
    WINEDEBUG=-all wine64 wineboot &>/dev/null
```

Our following `wine64 wineboot --init` just messes up with the prefix.

This PR fixes this issue.

Also https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1327 has been reverted as apparently it does not work. And https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1320 has been combined into this one.

events.body:
Apparently this change does not work -- see CI in https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1320.

> ACK [27504d5](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/commit/27504d5c941df89bc828067248270179c9dcb04b), tested in my personal Cirrus account.

I'm going to skim my CI logs to try to figure out why it passed.

Anyway, suggesting to revert this PR in https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1337.

> Apparently this change does not work -- see CI in https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1320.

I'm pretty sure that I could reliably reproduce D8037 in Docker locally, and moving WINEPREFIX to /tmp made this go away reliably. So, I'm rather convinced that there's some truth in this PR here, even if it fails now in #1320. (But yeah, we'll need to investigate further. Not sure at the moment).

issue.title: Upstream PRs 1314, 1317, 1318, 1316, 1327, 1310, 1328, 1333, 1330, 1334, 1337, 1341, 1339, 1350, 1349, 1338, 1129, 1347, 1336, 1295, 1354, 1355, 1356
issue.body:
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1314]: release cleanup: bump version after 0.3.2
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1317]: Make fe_cmov take max of magnitudes
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1318]: build: Enable -DVERIFY for precomputation binaries
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1316]: Do not invoke fe_is_zero on failed set_b32_limit
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1327]: ci: Move wine prefix to /tmp to avoid error D8037 in cl.exe
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1310]: Refine release process
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1328]: build: Bump MSVC warning level up to W3
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1333]: test: Warn if both `VERIFY` and `COVERAGE` are defined
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1330]: refactor: take use of `secp256k1_scalar_{zero,one}` constants
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1334]: fix input range comment for `secp256k1_fe_add_int`
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1337]: ci: Fix error D8037 in `cl.exe` (attempt 2)
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1341]: docs: correct `pubkey` param descriptions for `secp256k1_keypair_{xonly_,}pub`
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1339]: scalar: refactor: use `secp256k1_{read,write}_be32` helpers
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1350]: scalar: introduce and use `secp256k1_{read,write}_be64` helpers
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1349]: Normalize ge produced from secp256k1_pubkey_load
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1338]: Drop no longer needed `#include "../include/secp256k1.h"`
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1129]: ElligatorSwift + integrated x-only DH
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1347]: field: Document return value of fe_sqrt()
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1336]: Use `__shiftright128` intrinsic in `secp256k1_u128_rshift` on MSVC
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1295]: abi: Use dllexport for mingw builds
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1354]: Add ellswift to CHANGELOG
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1355]: Fix a typo in the error message
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1356]: ci: Adjust Docker image to Debian 12 "bookworm"

This PR can be recreated with `./contrib/sync-upstream.sh -b sync-upstream range 799f4eec`.
Tip: Use `git show --remerge-diff` to show the changes manually added to the merge commit.
